comment.body: This should read "BIKE-L5". Tests otherwise fail.

pull_request.title: Make BIKE decode function void to avoid ct issues
pull_request.body:
<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->
The `decode` function in BIKE was made void to avoid any potential constant-time issues.

<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->
Partially addresses #1396 

<!-- Please answer the following questions to help manage version and changes across projects. -->

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [ ] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming? Does this PR otherwise change an API? (If so, PRs in [oqs-provider](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider), [OQS-OpenSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl), [OQS-BoringSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/boringssl), and [OQS-OpenSSH](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh) will also need to be ready for review and merge by the time this is merged.)

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review from one of the OQS core team members. -->

repo.description: C library for prototyping and experimenting with quantum-resistant cryptography

comment.body:
Hm, I'm not sure why you see these CBOM changes again. You ran it after rebasing the branch with the fix in main?
I tried `copy_from_upstream.py copy` again from your branch and the CBOM didn't change. The CI run also seems to pass (i.e. CBOM doesn't change: https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/actions/runs/4344897416/jobs/7588854390).

pull_request.title: CI test copy_from_upstream
pull_request.body:
Replaces #1404, adding testing for correct use of `copy_from_upstream`. Depends on https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/ci-containers/pull/66 landing.

* [no] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [no] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming? Does this PR otherwise change an API? (If so, PRs in [oqs-provider](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider), [OQS-OpenSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl), [OQS-BoringSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/boringssl), and [OQS-OpenSSH](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh) will also need to be ready for review and merge by the time this is merged.)
